x203n.Action: Action

x203n.Description: The scanner is disabled and can’t be used.
x203n.Action: Enter the configuration menu, and re-enable the scanner module. See“840.xx service check” on page 2-41

x203n.Description: The scanner is disabled and can’t be used.
x203n.Action: This message is posted when the MFP PORs.Enter the configuration menu, and re-enable the scanner module. See“840.xx service check” on page 2-41
Image pipeline ASIC. See“Flatbed service check” on page 2-24.

x203n.Description: Service image processing unit: AFE register mismatch
Service image processing unit: SCNCHN DMA
Service image processing unit: new line too soon interrupt
Service image processing unit: tonal data overrun
Service image processing unit: image processing too slow
System time out: SIZAR out of band interrupt
Service image processing unit: output data uncollected
Service image processing unit: SCNCHN DMA underrun
Service image processing unit interrupt handler delayed crash
Scanner Failure: carriage failed to home or move todesired position

x203n.Action: ADF mechanical failure. Go to“ADF service check” on page 2-23
General mechanical failure. Go to“ADF service check” on page 2-23
Pick Roller engage failure. Go to“ADF service check” on page 2-23
Pick roller disengage failure. Go to“ADF service check” on page 2-23
Lamp failure. See“Flatbed service check” on page 2-24.

x203n.Description: Front scan module output level error
x203n.Action: See“Flatbed service check” on page 2-24

x203n.Description: Rear scan module output level error
Front scan module lamp level too low
x203n.Action: Front Mono channel, Front Color channels, Front Red channel, Front Green channel, and/or FrontBlue channel is detected to have low lamp level.See“Flatbed service check” on page 2-24

x203n.Description: Rear scan module lamp level too low
x203n.Action: Rear Mono channel, Rear Color channels, Rear Red channel, Rear Green channel, and/or RearBlue channel is detected to have low lamp level.See“Flatbed service check” on page 2-24
CIS failure See“Flatbed service check” on page 2-24

x203n.Description: Front scan module cable failure or SCC card failure
x203n.Action: CIS channel failure. Check each channel(mono,R, G, B) for identical values indicating bad cable and/or SCC card. Excessive noise test for the dark data indicating some sort of CIS or analog electronics issue on that channel or channels. See“Flatbed service check” on page 2-24

x203n.Description: Rear scan module cable failure or SCC card failure
x203n.Action: CIS channel failure. Check each channel(mono,R, G, B) for identical values indicating bad cable and/or SCC card. Excessive noise test for the dark data indicating some sort of CIS or analog electronics issue on that channel or channels. See“Flatbed service check” on page 2-24
Front scan module connector or cable failure See“Flatbed service check” on page 2-24
Rear scan module connector or cable failure See“Flatbed service check” on page 2-24
The connector cable is defective. See“Flatbed service check” on page 2-24.
Rear excessive variability for Mono, Red, Green,or Blue. See“Flatbed service check” on page 2-24
The Configuration ID bit that describes the device’s modem doesn’t match the actual modem installed in the device.

The amount of flash storage available on the device is too small. Note: The NAND Flash partition can shrink as bit failures cause blocks tobe invalidated. Go to“Format Fax Storage” on page 3-19. If the issue is not fixed, replace the controller board. Go to“Controller card removal” on page 4-13.
The devices’ flash partition is invalid orunavailable. Go to“Format Fax Storage” on page 3-19. If the issue is not fixed, replace the controller board. Go to“Controller card removal” on page 4-13.
A device has a modem installed, but its Configuration ID indicates that a modemshouldn’t be present.
Unrecoverable engine software error. Rest the MFP (POR). If the problem reoccurs, replace thecontroller board. See“Controller card service check” on page 2-25
Verify the motor is properly connected to the controller card.
Replace the transfer roll. See“Transfer roll service check” on page 2-44.

x203n.Description: Under temperature during steady state control.
x203n.Action: Replace the fuser. See“Fuser service check” on page 2-27.

x203n.Description: Fuser failed to ramp to target temperature
Wrong fuser installed. The fuser type stored in the cartridge ID does not match the actual fuser installed inthe printer.

x203n.Action: Replace the fan. See“Cooling fan servicecheck” on page 2-24.
Replace the printhead. See“Printhead service check” on page 2-32.

x203n.Error: Replace the printhead. See“Printhead service check” on page 2-32.

x203n.Description: Mirror motor locked: No hsync received
Motor unable to reach operating speed

x203n.Action: Replace the main motor gear drive. See“Main motor service check” on page 2-29
Replace the main motor gear drive. See“Main motor service check” on page 2-29
Replace the LVPS/HVPS. See“Hot fuser service check” on page 2-28.

x203n.Error: Controller board and operator panel service errors

x203n.Action: Replace the controller board. See“Controller card service check” on page 2-25.

x203n.Description: Mismatch between EEPROM and mirror memoryNote:A new controller board or operator panel has been installed, and has not been properly prepared for thisuse. Install a new note. Do not install both the controller board and the operator panel at the same time without a POR in between.
x203n.Action: Install a new controller bored or operator panel.See“Controller card service check” on page 2-25or“Operator panel service check” on page 2-31.

x203n.Description: The code ROM or NAND flash failed the Cyclic Redundancy Check or the NAND experienced anuncorrectible multi-bit failure.
x203n.Action: Replace the controller board. See“Controller card service check” on page 2-25.

x203n.Description: Printer has performed more than 100 “shift and reflash”operations as a result of ECC bit corrections
Failure to authenticate Signature Verification Code
x203n.Action: Call the next level of support to update the firmware, or replace the controller board. See“Controller card service check” on page 2-25.

x203n.Description: Signature Verification Code failed to authenticate a codepartition.
x203n.Action: Update firmware and call the next level ofsupport, or replace the controller board. See“Controller card service check” on page 2-25.
Update firmware and call the next level ofsupport, or replace the controller board. See“Controller card service check” on page 2-25
Replace the controller board. See“Controller card service check” on page 2-25.

x203n.Description: Controller did not respond to command request.

x203n.Action: Replace the controller board. See“Controller card service check” on page 2-25.

x203n.Description: Insufficient device space during HW prog
Incremental counter reset exceeds maximum value
Increment count failed due to max value limit
RAM memory error: RAM soldered on the controllerboard is bad
x203n.Action: Replace the controller board. See“Controller card service check” on page 2-25.

x203n.Description: Download Emulation Cyclic Redundancy Check Error:checksum failure detected in the emulation header or emulation file.
x203n.Action: Disable the Download Emulation. Program the download emulation into the firmware card again.If this does not resolve the problem, then replace the firmware card and download the emulation again.
Call the next level of support.

x203n.Description: Unrecoverable software error in network port
Bad checksum while programming network port
Flash parts failed while programing network port
Engine experiencing unreliable communication with the specified device
x203n.Action: Call the next level of support.

x203n.Description: Engine protocol violation detected by the specifieddevice
Communications error detected by the specified device
Invalid command received by the specified device
Invalid command parameter received by the specifieddevice
x203n.Action: Call the next level of support.

x203n.Description: An equipment check condition has occurred in the specified device, but the device is unable to identify theexact component failure.
The specified device has detected an equipment checkin its system card.
